args:
Convinced of the prince's character,
the Lightwyrm grants his pact. Moments later,
a mysterious girl appears with the whereabouts
of Zethia and King Aurelius, and the party sets
out for the Binding Ruins.
Strike down your brother and claim the\npact you seek, {player_name}!
I can't do that, Lightwyrm.\nBut hear me out.
This man is my brother—but more than\nthat, he is unarmed.
How can I bring peace and justice to my\npeople if I kill a defenseless individual?
You would answer so even knowing it ruins\nyour chance of forging a pact with me?
My answer ruins nothing, Jupiter.\nYou've been indulged long enough.
Emile is beaten, as you were before him.\nOnly one man remains to claim this pact.
A rather aggressive line of reasoning.
And if I don't see things quite the same?
I WILL have your obedience, Lightwyrm.\nBy force, if you insist on it.
If any among the hallowed ranks of\ndragonkind are wicked, I will hammer their\ncharacter straight like steel at the forge.
Guiding stray dragons back into the fold\nis my royal duty.
...Pfffffft! Aaaaaaah ha ha ha! Oh my, yes!\nYou've every bit the gall of Alberius the\nFounder himself!
It has been AGES since someone had the\nbrass to lecture me to my face!
I thought I was the best actor here,\nbut you've gone and stolen the show.
Actor? Then you never really intended—
I don't want a corpse rotting at my door!\nI was merely taking the measure of your\ncharacter, as promised.
And I do believe I've found a human\nworthy of me. It has been AGES.
Now look sharp! We have a sacred rite to\nperform.

I am the Lightwyrm, Jupiter—lord of
thunder and light, and master of these
peaks! Now shall I be the gleaming bolt
that smites your foes!
...Well then! I think that's everything.\nIt will be a pleasure working with you,\n{player_name}.
Again... AGAIN! Why him?\nWhy is it always HIM?!
I will see you kneel before me next time,\nBrother! Mark my words!
Goodness! It's rare to hear such a textbook\nline these days. Too bad he doesn't have\na mustache to twirl about as he speaks.
Don't worry, I won't hold him against you.\nYou can't pick your relatives, after all.
Pay him no mind and forget away, says I.
I can't forget. For all his failings,\nhe's still family.
And I can't help but hold out hope for him.\nHe's known more suffering than any of us.
Ha ha! It appears I've signed on with a\nhopeless optimist. How very ghastly.\nNow then, we— What?!
Someone's here. But who could have\nstolen into my territory without notice?
No... A fourth pact is sworn.
You're the woman from the forest.
What are you plotting, and how come\nyou're plotting it with her face?!
You wouldn't believe me even if I\nexplained.
But know that I am not your enemy.
I wanted to do this peacefully...
But you've already forged pacts with so\nmany.
Why do you have a problem with me and\nthe dragons? What's your aim in all this?
But with so many dragons pactbound,\nmy options are limited.
Make for the Binding Ruins. Victory there\nmay yet see this tragedy averted...
Binding Ruins? Never heard of it.
I have, but only in legend.
They speak of an ancient site known only\nto heirs of the Alberian throne and a\nselect few among the Church.
I know its location. You will find what you\nseek there.
King Aurelius and Zethia will be there,\nif things are as I know them to be.
Stay calm, {player_name}.\nWe have no reason to trust this woman.
He's right. It's obviously a trap.
Now shoo, hussy! Away from my darling!
Trap or no, I have to go. If there's any\nchance of saving her, no matter how\nsmall, I have to take it.
Besides, what trap could catch me with\nfriends like you at my side?
Plus, they'll have to face the Windwyrm,\nWaterwyrm, Flamewyrm, and Lightwyrm!
Indeed, it seems the Six Greatwyrms are\ngathering beneath your standard.
Of those that remain, Chthonius is said to\nhave fallen in battle. That leaves but one\nto find before we strike at the emperor.
Easier said than done, I fear.
The Shadowwyrm Zodiark is an extremely\npowerful dragon.
What's worse, I'm almost certain he's...
Hmm, no. I shouldn't assume anything\nwithout proof.
Let's get moving, then.\nTo the Binding Ruins?
{player_name}'s power grows greater still\nwith his fourth dragonpact now forged.
He makes now for the Binding Ruins, to save\nhis sister and learn the truth of his father's\ntransformation.
He keeps hope alive in his heart, unaware that\nwhat awaits him in those ruins is cold truth and\na most tragic reunion...
